project.name: TCP
project.notes: This is a simulation of the Internet Protocol, vastly simplified: There are only two nodes on the network, and their "IP addresses" are "Alice" and "Bob." Transmissions are divided into packets of length one character. The object of the exercise is to consider how to write reliable TCP on top of the lossy (losing data) IP implementation.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), hats = []; if (message !== '') { stage.lastMessage = message; process.getObjectsNamed(spriteName, this, stage).forEach(function (morph) { hats = hats.concat(morph.allHatBlocksFor(message)); }); hats.forEach(function (block) { stage.threads.startProcess(block, stage.isThreadSafe); }); }
